Class Dealer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Dealer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Dealer
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    The Dealer class is an extension of the JFrame object that fulfils many purposes in the operation of running the game of BlackJack. It initializes all of the Game Logic needed to play, including the two Dealer.Player runnables, a deck of cards (using the Pile class), all gui elements configured in Dealer(), thread management with Locks for sleep and wake each Player, and the Socket connections used to deliver input to each player.

    This class and it's lock and thread management is heavily modeled after the provided textbook example: "28_11_14".

    Author:
    Ben Mitchinson
    See Also:
    JFrame, Dealer.Player, Dealer(), Socket, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dealer

        public Dealer()
        The dealer constructor configures the GUI of the server log using JFrame elements. It then initializes both Dealer.Player objects, and configures a newly shuffled Pile to act as the deck for dealing. It also opens up the initial conditions for thread notifications upon later locks, and initializes the Socket connections to port 23516. It also deals 2 cards from the pile to the players for their opening hand.
        See Also:
        JFrame, Dealer.Player, Socket, Dealer.Player, ReentrantLock, Executors

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute()
        The execute method initializes two new player objects with the proper connections and titles, suspends until both are connected, and executes both threads, detailed in the Dealer.Player runnables.

      • displayMessage

        private void displayMessage(java.lang.String message)
        DisplayMessage is a method used throughout the class to properly log a message for display in the main server log text area.
        Parameters:
        message - the desired message to be displayed.
        See Also:
        SwingUtilities

      • isGameOver

        private boolean isGameOver()
        isGameOver calculates the total of each players hand using the Pile method getBlackjackTotal. Depending on which Dealer.Player holds a hand over 21, the method updates the required GUI elements of the game, and returns true so that dependent threads know to stop playing. Otherwise, if no players are over 21, the method returns false and the game continues.
        Returns:
        if the game is over or not based on player totals
